content.description:
This is a fun, easy slab line. 

  At the far right side of the boulder find the giant "block/flake" feature. Stand start palm-down on the slash(left hand) and use the crimp flake lobe (right). This gets you off the ground. Follow the easy compression moves up the feature and top out.

I know, I know... The name is dumb, but I had to think of something that would go along with a crux that involves "standing up". Whatever, it works. Its a cool line for sure. 

  Find the long low rail at the base of the middle of the boulder and stand start by stepping up onto that. Use a couple divots and smear up to the mid face where the holds disappear. Get a high foot and delicately "stand up" to the distant tiny crimps. Top out.

content.location: Route is to the right of Instigator Direct, and shares the start hold of Slim ShadySDS on the sharp rail near the middle of the boulder, make the first move up and left to the sidepull jug, continue straight up on jugs to top out

content.description:
Eliminate Alert! 

  For you boulder snobs out there who say calling the side of the boulder off is "too contrived for bouldering", please disregard this as an option. 

  Do the same start as instigator, only dont use the side of the boulder and climb direct up the thin, tricky face.

At the far left side of the Shady Boulder you can find a long, diagonal, juggy undercling flake rail. Stand start underclinging this and work up it toward the left side of the boulder. Once at the left corner jugs, follow it upward to top out.

This one is uphill and to the right from the Pyramid Boulder. Walk uphill for about 10 yards and then turn right and head parallel to the trail until you see the cool slab boulder. 

  This boulder has a beautiful, blank midface and some fun, easy lines on the left and right.
